intro: Cynanchum inaguense, commonly known as the Mexican milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes milkweeds, and is characterized by its milky sap, which can be toxic. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces showy, fragrant flowers that are usually yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
